Name: https://academic.oup.com/g3journal/article/11/1/jkaa036/6105578
Title: Visualizing population structure with variational autoencoders
Research question: Visualize population structure
Advantage: simple, Easy to plot
Disadvantage: limited embedding with two latent variables

Name: https://www.nature.com/articles/s42003-021-02622-z
Title: GenNet framework: interpretable deep learning for predicting phenotypes from genetic data
Research question: Predicting phenotypes
Which level: Cell type, Genes, Pathways, SNPs, Tissue type
Advantage: Every learned weight has a representation
Disadvantage: limitedly data driven, quality of prior knowledge
Why interpretable: Prior knowledge, weight per connection. (KEGG, gene annotations, GTEx)

Name: https://www.nature.com/articles/s41586-021-03922-4
Title: Biologically informed deep neural network for prostate cancer discovery
Research question: Predicting cancer
Data type: CNV, CpGs (methylation), Fusion, SNV, mRNA (gene expression)
Advantage: Every learned weight has a representation
Disadvantage: limitedly data driven, quality of prior knowledge

Name: https://journals.plos.org/ploscompbiol/article?id=10.1371/journal.pcbi.1009826
Title: AIME: Autoencoder-based integrative multi-omics data embedding that allows for confounder adjustments
Research question: Extract embedding from one omics that captures the relation to another omics
Advantage: Easy method, can be applied to any network
Disadvantage: only pairwise effects observable (1 input feature - 1 output feature), model-based approach needed to select which features really are important
Why interpretable: Permutation of input - observe effect on output

Name: https://www.nature.com/articles/s41467-021-26017-0
Title: VEGA is an interpretable generative model for inferring biological network activity in single-cell transcriptomics
Research question: VEGA: building an interpretable AE for single cell data
Advantage: latent variables are directly interpretable as the activity of biological modules; can do well-known analyses (e.g. differential gene expression) directly on latent features
Disadvantage: quality of prior knowledge, linear (single layer) decoder → generative capacity limited; “sacrifices predictive performance for biological interpretability”
Notes: not sure semi-local or global
Why interpretable: latent variables are forced to be connected to only a specific set of genes → activity of latent feature = activity of gene set

Name: https://www.biorxiv.org/content/10.1101/2022.02.05.479217v1
Title: Biologically informed deep learning to infergene program activity in single cells
Research question: Develop an interpretable bottleneck for single-cell data
Advantage: latent variables are directly interpretable as the activity of biological modules; ability to construct custom gene lists for annotation; allows other genes to be added to gene list (counteracts incomplete manual curation); allow to learn novel gene lists unsupervised
Disadvantage: Linear decoder. Requires a lot of data
Notes: not sure semi-local or global
Why interpretable: uses regularized linear decoders (add penalty term on the weights of the linear decoder)

Name: https://www.nature.com/articles/s41540-021-00193-7
Title: MethylSPWNet and MethylCapsNet: Biologically Motivated Organization of DNAm Neural Networks, Inspired by Capsule Networks
Research question: interpretability by organization of DNAm into biologically relevant capsules
Advantage: custom capsules can be designed
Disadvantage: bottleneck of prior knowledge needed, computational limit of possible numbers of capsules

Name: https://bmcbioinformatics.biomedcentral.com/articles/10.1186/s12859-018-2500-z
Title: PASNet: pathway-associated sparse deep neural network for prognosis prediction from high-throughput data
Research question: build interpretable NN for GBM prediction; first paper with visible biological networks?!  They mention DCelll as predecessor
Advantage: Every learned weight has a representation
Disadvantage: quality of prior knowledge

Name: https://www.biorxiv.org/content/10.1101/2022.09.05.506572v1
Title: Attention-based GCN integrates Multi-omics Data for Breast Cancer Subtype Classification and Patient-specific Gene Marker Identification
Research question: Breast cancer mulltiomics integration and prediction
Advantage: biological connections (PPI) are network architecture
Disadvantage: quality / abundance of prior knowledge (only took high confidence PPI)

Name: https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s00521-019-04616-9
Title: A snapshot neural ensemble method for cancer-type prediction based on copy number variations
Research question: Predict cancer using CNV
Advantage: to apply GradCAM to biological input, they simply reshaped 1D → 2D and normalised between [0,255]
Disadvantage: derived heatmaps are useless for interpretation (Figure 9); uncover few useful genes (unclear if due to approach or data)

Name: https://bmcbioinformatics.biomedcentral.com/articles/10.1186/s12859-020-3465-2
Title: PathME: pathway based multi-modal sparse autoencoders for clustering of patient-level multi-omics data
Research question: Cluster patients based on multi-omics data
Advantage: map multi-omics to pathways, which are input to network → much fewer connections
Disadvantage: encodes each pathway seperately for each entity → simplifies the problem (too much?)

Name: https://arxiv.org/abs/2003.03462)
Title: BasisVAE: Translation-invariant feature-level clustering with Variational Autoencoders
Research question: Simulatenously reduce dimension + cluster in latent space of a VAE
Advantage: fixes bottleneck that latent dimension can now be directly interpreted
Disadvantage: could not show how useful clustering can be biologically

Name: https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/?term=Alessandri%20L%5BAuthor%5Dhttps://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC7785742/
Title: Sparsely Connected Autoencoders: A Multi-Purpose Tool for Single Cell omics Analysis
Research question: make an interpretable embedding for AE
Advantage: customisable, provide metric measuring clustering accuracy
Disadvantage: only 1 layer AE, use only experimentally validated prior knowledge → this is not a lot

Name: https://www.biorxiv.org/content/10.1101/2021.09.15.460498v2
Title: Interpretable deep generative models for genomics
Research question: make an interpretable embedding for VAE
Post-hoc interpretation method: DeepLIFT, Grad * Int, Integrated gradients, SHAP
Advantage: shows good performance; universal; enables direct gene regulatory network analysis
Disadvantage: complicated to understand
Notes:
interpretation similar to probabilistic PCA; adds also an “interpretability
regularization term”

Name: https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S2667237521001235
Title: A mixture-of-experts deep generative model for integrated analysis of single-cell multiomics data
Research question: build framework for single-cell multiomics
Advantage: interpreting latent dimensions by perturbing and correlating result with input features → high correlation = embedded there
Disadvantage: amount of available data is for rare cell populations limited

Name: https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S1525157821002154
Title: Identification of Tissue of Origin and Guided Therapeutic Applications in Cancers of Unknown Primary Using Deep Learning and RNA Sequencing (TransCUPtomics)
Research question: predict (unkown) tissue of origin of cancers
Advantage: easy to implement and understand
Disadvantage: only 1 layer deep → effectively only linear

Name: https://www.biorxiv.org/content/10.1101/2021.12.21.473742v1
Title: Explainable autoencoder-based representation learning for gene expression data
Research question: build an explainable AE
Advantage: easy to implement; identifies genes besides DEG
Disadvantage: SHAP uses a linear model to approximate, not unsupervised (needs an endpoint to predict)

Name: https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s00521-003-0388-6
Title:
A neuro-fuzzy approach for functional genomics data interpretation
and analysis
Research question: Fuzzy networks for predicting functional classes for gene of E.coli
Advantage: combines implicit and explicit knowledge
Disadvantage: rule set offers partial explanation and is harder to interpret if more factors contribute.
Notes: eligible to exclude, did not use human data

Name: https://www.science.org/doi/10.1126/science.aat8464
Title: Comprehensive functional genomic resource and integrative model for the human brain
Research question: integrative models for the functional genomics of the human brain
Which level: Cell type, Gene sets, Genes, Pathways
Advantage: incorperated the found gene regulatory network in a visible neural network (deep boltzman machine) to improve prediction.
Disadvantage: Complex model with multiple inputs and a lot of additional analyses to obtain the prior knowledge required to build the deep learning model.
Notes:
imputed genotypes; intermediate phenotype data including gene expression, enhancer H3K27ac
activation levels, cell fraction estimates, and co-expression module mean expression

Name: https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/35936793/
Title: MetastaSite: Predicting metastasis to different sites using deep learning with gene expression data
Research question: predicts whether patients’ samples are primary (localized) or metastasized to different regions
Advantage: layer-wise interpretation of biological processes
Disadvantage: unclear why AE was used here → fancy feature selection? Simply identified highly correlated genes?

Name: https://www.pnas.org/doi/epdf/10.1073/pnas.2114021119
Title: Interpretable modeling of genotype–phenotype landscapes withstate-of-the-art predictive power
Research question: model genotype phenotype landscape (epistatic effects) in a fully interpretable model
Advantage: low dimensional space similar to PCA. Effects of mutations can be represented by vectors in this space. Uncertainty measures from gaussian proces.
Disadvantage: There are still multiple dimensions. Currently, two main components are visualized but if the latent space is larger information will be lost. The method provides global insight and uncertainty but is not fully interpretable.
Notes: First they model the genotype space as a an additive low-dimensional space and then they use Gaussian processes to model nonlinear (epistatic) effects on protein stability

Title: Deriving meaningful rules from gene expression data for classification
Research question: deriving rules from gene expression datato destinguish between cancer types
Advantage: fuzzy rules might improve generalization
Disadvantage: Rules are derived from clusters so only a few rules per class are derived
Notes: Online feature selection during training of a small neural network followed by fuzzy clustering

Name: https://academic.oup.com/bioinformatics/article/37/Supplement_1/i443/6319702
Title: PathCNN: interpretable convolutional neural networks for survival prediction and pathway analysis applied to glioblastoma
Research question: Predicting long term survival for cancer using interpretable neural networks for multi-omics data
Advantage: Combines multi-omics data in a CNN architecture resulting in a strong computational model that is interpretable
Disadvantage: Input (pathway image) is a PCA of the inputs of the associated genes of the pathways,

Name: https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1002/gepi.20307
Title:
Comparison of Approaches for Machine-Learning Optimization
of Neural Networks for Detecting Gene-Gene Interactions
in Genetic Epidemiology
Research question: Grammatical evolution to optimize neural networks
Advantage: Evolutionary driven neural network architectures
Disadvantage: Computationally intensive, interpretetation method not specified.
Notes: not really focussed on interpretation, resutls in visible neural networks?

Name: https://arxiv.org/abs/2207.09783
Title: Cancer Subtyping by Improved Transcriptomic Features Using Vector Quantized Variational Autoencoder
Research question: Cancer Subtyping
Advantage: show very high clustering improvement
Disadvantage: no feature-level interpretation; novel clusters identified need yet to be validated
Notes: cant find sample size and inputsize

Name: https://academic.oup.com/bioinformatics/article/36/12/3818/5811233
Title: Cancer subtype classification and modeling by pathway attention and propagation
Research question: Cancer subtype classification
Advantage: Includes prior knowledge in a GCNs, combines these in an ensemble with attention for a strong interpretable model. Network propagation adds extra explenations
Disadvantage:
difficult to know what
part of the pathway was useful for characterizing the cancers
Notes: empty git

Name: https://academic.oup.com/g3journal/article/12/3/jkac020/6515290
Title: A deep learning framework for characterization of genotype data
Research question: Visualize population structure
Advantage: convolution seems to improve LD accuracy
Disadvantage: high computational cost, limited embedding with two latent variables

Name: https://ieeexplore.ieee.org/document/9119109
Title: SAERMA: Stacked Autoencoder Rule Mining Algorithm for the Interpretation of Epistatic Interactions in GWAS for Extreme Obesity
Research question: Identify epistasis for obesity
Advantage: uncovers knowns + unknown interactions; fully transparent
Disadvantage: very stringent preprocessing limits novelty; limited performance with a reasonable number of rules

Name: https://academic.oup.com/nargab/article/3/4/lqab097/6412605
Title:
ParsVNN: parsimony visible neural networks for uncovering cancer-specific and drug-sensitive genes
and pathways
Research question: Predict drug response for cancers
Advantage: Improves performance and interpretabiluty of DrugCell by pruning the network
Disadvantage: no information about interactions or missing prior knowledge

Name: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC7737474/
Title: Predicting Drug Response and Synergy Using a Deep Learning Model of Human Cancer Cells
Research question: Predict drug response for cancers
Advantage: can suggest combination therapies
Disadvantage: no information about interactions or missing prior knowledge

Name: https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/35011647/
Title: Interpretable Autoencoders Trained on Single Cell Sequencing Data Can Transfer Directly to Data from Unseen Tissues
Research question: Demonstrate transfer learning for AE
Advantage: shows autoencoder can mode a transcriptional representation over different tissue datasets
Disadvantage: no in depth analysis on e.g. preserved genes per tissue

Title: MoGCN: A Multi-Omics Integration Method Based on Graph Convolutional Network for Cancer Subtype Analysis
Research question: Cancer subtype classification
Advantage: nicely combines two framework (GCN and AE)
Disadvantage: feature selection with AE makes use of old strategy (1991) - how would newer approaches perform?
Notes: Interpretation through sensitivity analysis (Garson, 1991)

Name: https://www.nature.com/articles/nmeth.4627
Title: Using deep learning to model the hierarchical structure and function of a cell
Research question: Predicting yeast cell growth from genotype
Advantage: One of the more impactful VNN papers. Introduces RLIPP. compares to boolean logic and performance validated by experiments (in vivo)
Disadvantage: was only used in yeast data, not human

Name: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC9032252/
Title:
LINA: A Linearizing Neural Network Architecture for Accurate
First-Order and Second-Order Interpretations
Research question: epistasis detection
Advantage: Allows extraction of first and second order interactions
Disadvantage: Needs an additional linearization layer in the network

Name: https://academic.oup.com/bioinformatics/article/38/9/2504/6546279
Title: GraphGONet: a self-explaining neural network encapsulating the Gene Ontology graph for phenotype prediction on gene expression
Research question: Cancer prediction from gene expression with interpretable nn
Advantage: allows patient and model interpretation
Disadvantage: Only the top n GO terms are used for interpretation

Name: https://academic.oup.com/bib/article/22/6/bbab315/6353242
Title: XOmiVAE: an interpretable deep learning model for cancer classification using high-dimensional omics data
Research question: Cancer classification
Advantage: simultaneously interpret input features and reduced dimension
Disadvantage: needs reference values to calculate the SHAP values → tricky to select!; compared performance mostly to results generated with random genes

Name: https://www.nature.com/articles/s41467-021-26017-0
Title: VEGA is an interpretable generative model for inferring biological network activity in single-cell transcriptomics
Research question: Analysis of single-cell data
Advantage: user-defined modules; can directly add DEG on these custom modules; also compared other sparse combinations (e.g. sparse encoder, fully connected decoder)
Disadvantage: linear decoder (limited generative capacity); depends on prior knowledge

Name: https://academic.oup.com/bioinformatics/article/34/17/i629/5093210
Title: Discovering epistatic feature interactions from neural network models of regulatory DNA sequences
Research question: Detecting epistasis in sequences
Model architecture: Convolutional Neural Network (CNN), Dense neural network
Advantage: Can use multiple feature attribution methods.
Disadvantage: dependance on performance (but so are all). Can explain a part of the input sequence, but an overview of all input sequence pertubatations will be computationally expensive (but still cheaper than pairwise methods)
Notes: Propose pertubation framework in combination with Deeplift and such: Deep Feature Interaction Maps (DFIM)

Name: https://www.medrxiv.org/content/10.1101/2021.10.11.21264761v1
Title: Explainable Transformer-Based Neural Network for the Prediction of Survival Outcomes in Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer (NSCLC)
Research question: Novel survival prediction method for NSCLC
Advantage: Utilise transfer-learning for weight initialisation (combat small sample sizes
Disadvantage: computationally very expensive (max. 300 features)

Name: https://bmcbioinformatics.biomedcentral.com/articles/10.1186/s12859-021-04370-7
Title: Deep GONet: self-explainable deep neural network based on Gene Ontology for phenotype prediction from gene expression data
Research question: Predict cancers from gene expression
Advantage: can control trade-off between interpretability and performance, can possible improve GO by finding  relevant connections
Disadvantage: computationally ineffcient (the weights are still stored of NOGO)

Name: https://www.nature.com/articles/s42256-020-00244-4.pdf
Title: An interpretable deep-learning architecture of capsule networks for identifying cell-type gene expression programs from single-cell RNA-sequencing data
Research question: cell labeling based on expression with capsule networks
Advantage: Interpretation for capsule networks
Disadvantage: PCA on the weights for each capsule and then trying to find thresholds for the pricipal components seems a bit weak/ not really interpretable

Name: https://www.biorxiv.org/content/10.1101/2021.10.30.466610v1.full
Title: Development of Biologically Interpretable Multimodal Deep Learning Model for Cancer Prognosis Prediction
Research question: Cancer prognosis prediction
Advantage: took clinical covariates into account; used images + omics
Disadvantage: did not fully integrate data (just aggregate unimodal embeddings); could not link omics to histology

Name: https://bmcmedgenomics.biomedcentral.com/articles/10.1186/s12920-020-0658-5
Title: DeepTRIAGE: interpretable and individualised biomarker scores using attention mechanism for the classification of breast cancer sub-types
Research question:
Classification of
breast cancer sub-types
Advantage: constructed own NN framework top enable application of attention to omics (high-dimensional); provide individualised biomarker estimate
Disadvantage: not compared to other, more conventional, interpretation methods

Name: https://www.nature.com/articles/s41598-021-81773-9.pdf
Title: Verifying explainability of a deep learning tissue classifer trained on RNA‑seq data
Research question: Show/verify interpretability with SHAP for a DL network applied to tissue classification.
Advantage: found great overlap with traditional method for identifying differently expressed genes
Disadvantage: Did not show real advantage over traditional method

Name: https://bmcbioinformatics.biomedcentral.com/articles/10.1186/s12859-020-03717-w
Title: An embedded gene selection method using knockoffs optimizing neural network
Research question: find key genes using neural network
Advantage: Is able to select important genes
Disadvantage: Computationally expensive, adds a fake feature for each input feature, does not seem to have advantages over standard methods

Name: https://journals.plos.org/ploscompbiol/article?id=10.1371/journal.pcbi.1010328
Title: Explainable deep transfer learning model for disease risk prediction using high-dimensional genomic data
Research question: Predict genetic risk with neural entwork
Advantage: Can capture non-linear effects, computationally efficient
Disadvantage: Trained per region, so limited in long range interaction. Where is the validation set?
Notes: Compares permuted labels loss with real loss per region network to evaluate the importance of a region

Name: https://academic.oup.com/bioinformatics/article/38/Supplement_2/ii120/6702000
Title: GNN-SubNet: disease subnetwork detection with explainable graph neural networks
Research question: GCN for disease subnetwork detection for cancers
Advantage: Networks with PPI information improved robustness. PPI information resulted in less widespread signal from genes
Disadvantage: Did not obtain better performance than baseline methods

Name: https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/16987708/
Title: Identification of critical genes in microarray experiments by a Neuro-Fuzzy approach
Research question: Interpreting bacterium-host interactions
Advantage: included bootstrapping to estimate robustness of derived feature importance
Disadvantage: based on simple rules

Name: https://genomemedicine.biomedcentral.com/articles/10.1186/s13073-021-00845-7
Title: Explaining decisions of graph convolutional neural networks: patient-specific molecular subnetworks responsible for metastasis prediction in breast cancer
Research question: Personalised metastasis prediction in breast cancer
Advantage: extensive validation: included sanity check of interpretability approach using MNIST data, comparison to WGCNA
Disadvantage: based on prior knowledge of input graph (PPI); computational very heavy
Notes: “Graph Layer-wise Relevance Propagation”

Name: https://bmcbioinformatics.biomedcentral.com/articles/10.1186/s12859-020-03850-6#availability-of-data-and-materials
Title: Investigating the relevance of major signaling pathways in cancer survival using a biologically meaningful deep learning model
Research question: Patient survival prediction with investigation of major signaling pathways
Advantage: Density distribution of relevance scores → estimate robustness better!
Disadvantage: limited to prior knowledge and selection of pathways under study
Notes: Implementation: iNNvestigate package

Name: https://www.liebertpub.com/doi/10.1089/cmb.2019.0320
Title: Explainable Deep Learning for Augmentation of Small RNA Expression Profiles
Research question: Prediction of missing metadata
Advantage: analysis on different levels - sample, class; added stability estimates through permutation
Disadvantage: heavily limited by class imbalances (e.g. of rare tissues)

Name: https://biodatamining.biomedcentral.com/articles/10.1186/s13040-021-00285-4
Title: Integrating pathway knowledge with deep neural networks to reduce the dimensionality in single-cell RNA-seq data
Research question: Predict cell-types in scData
Advantage: directly merge visualisation and prediction in one framework
Disadvantage: not possible to interrogate which pathways are important for prediction

Name: https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s12031-020-01514-x
Title: Application of Artificial Neural Network for Prediction of Risk of Multiple Sclerosis Based on Single Nucleotide Polymorphism Genotypes
Research question: Application to multiple sclerosis
Disadvantage: study limited by the little number of features used

Name: https://bmcmedgenomics.biomedcentral.com/articles/10.1186/s12920-019-0624-2
Title: Interpretable deep neural network for cancer survival analysis by integrating genomic and clinical data
Research question: Cancer survival analysis
Advantage: nice to see directly Kaplan-Meier plots for individual pathways
Disadvantage: prior knowledge

Name: https://journals.plos.org/plosone/article?id=10.1371/journal.pone.0269570
Title: Pathway importance by graph convolutional network and Shapley additive explanations in gene expression phenotype of diffuse large B-cell lymphoma
Research question: Estimate pathways-based diffuse large B-cell lymphoma subtypes
Advantage: thoroughly compared to GSEA
Disadvantage: prior knowledge, worse prediction than logistic regression model, SHAP doesn’t provide confidence intervals / robustness estimtates

Name: https://bmcbioinformatics.biomedcentral.com/articles/10.1186/s12859-017-1984-2
Title: A biological network-based regularized artificial neural network model for robust phenotype prediction from gene expression data
Research question: phenotype prediction from gene expression data
Advantage: Directly interpretable. Investigated carefully effects of regularization.
Disadvantage: Not much attention on interpretation. The authors selected the top connections with heighest weight in a CV but did they normalize after each layer?
Notes: Interpretability through bootstrapping

Name: https://academic.oup.com/bioinformatics/article/37/12/1772/5919581
Title: Varmole: a biologically drop-connect deep neural network model for prioritizing disease risk variants and genes
Research question: Interpretable model for phenotype prediction, applied to among others schizophrenia
Advantage: Dropconnect and L1 penalty to add sparsity. Gene regulatory networks and eQTL as prior knowledge in the first layer
Disadvantage: Integrated gradients, hidden layers after using prior knowledge makes interpretation harder.

Name: https://arxiv.org/abs/1906.00537
Title: Incorporating Biological Knowledge with Factor Graph Neural Network for Interpretable Deep Learning
Research question: Build a transparent Factor Graph Neural Network
Advantage: attention mechanism to assign weights to connections between different layers → not as limited to prior knowledge?
Disadvantage: very low prediction performances; no biological interpretation of recovered pathways
Notes: FGNN “generalizes the Graph Convolutional Network”

Name: https://www.nature.com/articles/s41540-022-00218-9
Title: Deep neural network prediction of genome-wide transcriptome signatures – beyond the Black-box
Research question: Predict gene expression from transcription factors
Advantage: good validation: perturbation results compared to real interaction values; perturbation captures not only magnitude, but also direction of interaction (activator, inhibitor)!
Disadvantage: Perturbation of hidden nodes: arbitrary number of genes (500) were taken into account for downstream analyses
Notes: Perturbation = “light-up” analysis; . Dwivedi et al. (2020)

Name: https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/epdf/10.1002/gepi.20345 (2008)
Title: A Comparison of Analytical Methods for Genetic Association Studies
Research question: Compare performance of machine learning methods for epistasis detection
Advantage: Evolutionary algorithm to create small sparse neural networks
Disadvantage: computationally very expensive

Name: https://www.nature.com/articles/s41514-021-00068-5
Title: Modeling transcriptomic age using knowledge-primed artificial neural networks
Research question: predict age from gene expression with visible neural networks
Advantage: improved performance and stability by ensemble of visible neural networks
Disadvantage:
ensemble is less interpretable:” Based on our data, this suggests
that there is a small trade-off between transparency and precision, albeit at a rate that might well be tolerable in practice”
Notes:
correlation analysis of
the intermediate neuron outputs with the actual ages. in-silico knockout of genes (pertubation) to estimate the effects. MSE of output neurons and pathway neurons in the loss.

Name: https://arxiv.org/abs/1801.06202
Title: A graph-embedded deep feedforward network for disease outcome classification and feature selection using gene expression data
Research question: Predict cancer
Advantage: Includes prior knowledge to limit parameters, but also uses dense layers for good classification accuracy
Disadvantage: only limited prior knowledge can be used (→ only one sparse layer!)

Name: https://www.nature.com/articles/s41467-021-25534-2
Title: Learning interpretable cellular and gene signature embeddings from single-cell transcriptomic data
Research question: Learn an interpretable embeddding for multiple scRNA-seq datasets
Advantage: Implemented strong baselines, showed transfer learning and interpretability.  A  linear decoder coupled with prior knowledge learns topic and gene embeddings
Disadvantage: Requires 192 GB ram to train. UMAP still seems to do some heavy lifting (but the inclusion of genes and topics in the same embeddidng make it more interpretable)

Name: https://www.biorxiv.org/content/10.1101/2021.01.28.428715v1
Title: deepManReg: a deep manifold-regularized learning model for improving phenotype prediction from multi-modal data
Research question: Predict phenotypes from multi-modal data
Advantage:
uses cross-modal
manifolds to find similarity of features of different modalities
Disadvantage: larger datasets include difficult hyperparameter optimisation (many parameter combinations)
Notes: PATCH-seq: transcriptomics and electrophysiology

Name: https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S2001037021001793
Title: DeepOmix: A scalable and interpretable multi-omics deep learning framework and application in cancer survival analysis
Research question: multi-omics cancer survival analysis
Advantage: Combines multi-omics data. Combines functional layer (Kegg, reactome) with hidden layers.  Uses Kolmogorov-Smirnov test to find significant pathways
Disadvantage: Interpretation of the network is not really tested.

Name: https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/35783280/
Title: Path-ATT-CNN: A Novel Deep Neural Network Method for Key Pathway Identification of Lung Cancer
Research question: Identifying pathways for long cancer
Advantage: Uses X-Grad-CAM to obtain importance scores (supposedly better than GradCam)
Disadvantage: Not clearly written. PCA to obtain the pathway image reduces details in the input data.
Notes: I might have misunderstood some detailbe because of a language barrier

Name: https://www.biorxiv.org/content/10.1101/2022.01.18.476842v1
Title: Deep learning based on multi-omics integration identifies potential therapeutic targets in breast cancer
Research question: Use multi-omics to predict mortality & stratify breast cancer patients
Data type: CNV, CpGs (methylation), SNV, mRNA (gene expression), miRNA, proteome
Advantage: Uses many omics entities; clusters according to survival; ranks feature importances across modalities
Disadvantage: The choice of employed explanability method is not described, but would be interesting. Benefits to other (newer) methosd?
Notes: “Olden’s approach” - Olden, J.D., Joy, M.K., Death, R.G. 2004. An accurate comparison of methods for quantifying variable importance in artificial neural networks using simulated data. Ecological Modelling. 178:389-397.

Name: https://academic.oup.com/nargab/article/2/1/lqaa011/5742219
Title: An interpretable low-complexity machine learning framework for robust exome-based in - silico diagnosis of Crohn’s disease patients
Research question: Diagnosis of Crohn’s diseae
Advantage: interesting strategy to encode WES information and everything associated to it in one input vector with multiple dimensions per gene
Disadvantage: Shallow and few nodes → sufficient to model signal?
Notes: just sum up connection-weights

Name: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC8584109/
Title:
Classification and Functional Analysis between Cancer and
Normal Tissues Using Explainable Pathway Deep Learning
through RNA-Sequencing Gene Expression
Research question: Distinguish cancer from normal tissue
Advantage: Compared many pathway databases for prior knowledge
Disadvantage: all reported performances are incredibly high, even when using random genes → model overfitted?

Name: https://academic.oup.com/bioinformatics/advance-article/doi/10.1093/bioinformatics/btac696/6769889
Title: DeepPerVar: a multi-modal deep learning framework for functional interpretation of genetic variants in personal genome
Research question:
Predict genome-wide epigenetic signals and evaluate the functional
consequence of non-coding variants
Advantage: Multi-model approach of predicting epigentic motfis. Uses paired data.
Disadvantage: Very limited in terms of interpretation. Compares output of first conv filters with known human motifs with Tomtom (gupta et al. 2007)

Name: https://genomebiology.biomedcentral.com/articles/10.1186/s13059-020-02100-5
Title: Knowledge-primed neural networks enable biologically interpretable deep learning on single-cell sequencing data
Research question: Create an interpetatble neural network
Advantage: Uses dropout and input dropout to improve interpretability. Also evaluates the importance of the node localtion/connectivity in the networks architecture by comparing to a the same node in the same architecture trained on simulated data
Disadvantage: Improved accuracy of the interpretation by weights but did not complement this with other methods to obtain more insights in differences between individuals etc
Notes: input size unspecified?

Name: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC9481367/pdf/JO2022-2965166.pdf
Title: A Deep Neural Network for Gastric Cancer Prognosis Prediction Based on Biological Information Pathways
Research question: Gastric Cancer Prognosis Prediction with multi-omics data
Advantage: A variant on P-net, with sankey diagram. Multi-omics data
Disadvantage: only CNV and somatic mutations (P-net has more). No new additions.

Name: https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/10371154/
Title: Analysis of gene expression data using self-organizing maps
Research question: Visualise and analyse expression microarray data
Advantage: Avant-garde work; doesn’t only group according to expression pattern but also functional relation
Disadvantage: Suffers from lack of knowledge for most genes - only few can be interpreted biologically per derived cluster; not clear if group according to biological function or correlation pattern

Name: https://ieeexplore.ieee.org/document/4272033
Title: 2D and 3D Neural-Network Based Visualization of High-Dimensional Biomedical Data
Research question: Extend visualisation into 3rd dimension with SOM
Advantage: higher resolution; interactive; scales well with input dimensions
Disadvantage: can not capture more complex interactions

Name: https://www.biorxiv.org/content/10.1101/2021.01.22.427799v2.full.pdf
Title: REM: An Integrative Rule Extraction Methodology for Explainable Data Analysis in Healthcare
Research question: Extract rule set from neural network
Advantage: Ruleset, thus noise removal, no unexpected outcomes.
Disadvantage: Rules set has a reduced accuracy, thus does not capture the whole model.

Name: https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/36217547/
Title: Deep learning explains the biology of branched glycans from single-cell sequencing data
Research question: Predict glycan phenotypes of cells
Advantage: accounted for inherent randomness during model construction by averaging SHAP of 3 replicates; comparison to DEG & permutation
Disadvantage: arbitrary cut-off of top 10% of SHAP values for further analysis

Name: https://journals.plos.org/plosgenetics/article?id=10.1371/journal.pgen.1009754
Title: Multi-scale inference of genetic trait architecture using biologically annotated neural networks
Research question: predict phenotypes using interpretable neural networks (BANNs)
Advantage: Bayesian neural network, thus a distribution over the weights. Large input space, implemented in tensorflow, numpy and R
Disadvantage: Only gene information, very limited depth.

Name: https://arxiv.org/ftp/arxiv/papers/2109/2109.14719.pdf
Title:
Deep neural networks with controlled variable selection for the identification of putative causal
genetic variants
Research question: Interpretable neural network with knockoff for finding putative genes
Advantage: Knockoff, hierarchical structure for more efficient architecture.
Disadvantage: An extra input for each input is computationally inefficient. Only gradient is used for importance

Name: https://link.springer.com/content/pdf/10.1007/s12031-019-01311-1.pdf
Title:
Application of Single-Nucleotide Polymorphisms in the Diagnosis
of Autism Spectrum Disorders: A Preliminary Study with Artificial
Neural Networks
Research question: Neural network to predict autism
Advantage: Simple small standard neural network
Disadvantage: only uses 15 associated SNPs, does not compare to other methods. Cross validation without test set.

Name: https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/32974946/
Title: Genome-wide association study-based deep learning for survival prediction
Research question: Neural network for predicting age-related macular degeneration survival
Advantage: Adapted LIME for survivial (1000 features perturbed, fit linear regression between input and output of model, rank absolute coeffcients). Identify subgroups
Disadvantage: Relativly small number of input SNPs (max 1500)

Name: https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/32872133/
Title: Fully-Connected Neural Networks with Reduced Parameterization for Predicting Histological Types of Lung Cancer from Somatic Mutations
Research question: Predicting lung cancer types
Advantage: Diet networks do not need backpropogation so it is easier to make large networks.
Disadvantage: The diet networks only had 2 million parameters, so was the diet network used in it’s strenght? Would be nice to see how big equivalent network would be. Learning curve seems flat. It was unclear how they chose their hyperparameters.
Notes: Used principle component analysis (PCA) on the embedding of the additional networks. Since they receive an transposed input the latent space is filled with genes.

Name: https://arxiv.org/abs/1909.04169
Title: OncoNetExplainer: Explainable Predictions of Cancer Types Based on Gene Expression Data
Research question: Explainable prediction of cancer type
Advantage: comparison / validation using 2 explainability approaches and models (however, results do not overlap)
Disadvantage: GradCam 2D heatmaps of gene expression very difficult to interpret
Notes: They use 2 different setups: CNN+GradCam and Gradient Boosted Trees + SHAP and identified biomarkers don’t overlap at all!!

Name: https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S1046202321000165
Title: Prediction and interpretation of cancer survival using graph convolution neural networks
Research question: Predict cancer survival rates
Advantage: graph enables expansion of analysis to associated genes (network module-based analysis)
Disadvantage: adding up weights not most accurate; limited by prior knowledge of graph construction

Name: https://hal.archives-ouvertes.fr/hal-03119399/document
Title: Using Feature Selection and Ensemble Algorithms for Sophisticated Pancreatic Cancer Diagnosis
Research question: Pancreatic cancer diagnosis
Advantage: employed different models and interpretability methods
Disadvantage: explainability results derived by SHAP and LIME barely overlap
Notes: explainability results derived by SHAP and LIME barely overlap

Name: https://genomebiology.biomedcentral.com/articles/10.1186/s13059-022-02681-3#Abs1
Title: Identifying common transcriptome signatures of cancer by interpreting deep learning models
Research question: Predict cancer
Advantage: can conduct FDR calculation; gives direction of effect (positive influence, negative influence)
Disadvantage: needs baseline model to compare to; direction of effect not easily relatable to effect on gene expression (high attribution is not elevated expression)

Title: Pathomic Fusion: An Integrated Framework for Fusing Histopathology and Genomic Features for Cancer Diagnosis and Prognosis
Research question: Predict cancer survival rates
Advantage: Very fancy approach of learning  morphometric cell features from histology images with GCN; special effort merging multimodal entities
Disadvantage: very complex framework (but git seems to be well maintained!)

Name: https://www.biorxiv.org/content/10.1101/2022.05.03.490535v1
Title: Principled feature attribution for unsupervised gene expression analysis
Research question: Build explainable sparse autoencoder (mix of post-hoc and direct explainability approaches)
Advantage: addresses many problems of interpretable autoencoders (e.g. lack of estimation of variance captured by latent features); give more detailed info on which genes are important in activated pathways
Disadvantage: “Unsupervised pathway attributions do not always capture all pathways that differ significantly between two groups of interest, if those pathways do not represent major sources of expression variation”
Notes: highlights (and addresses) problems of “traditional” visible/spares AE

Name: https://europepmc.org/article/ppr/ppr415059
Title: DeepMAPS: Single-cell biological network inference using heterogeneous graph transformer
Research question: Biological network inference from single-cell multi-omics
Advantage: multi-omics integration, available online on webserver. Can generate gene association networks
Disadvantage: Not deterministic thus reproducibility over multiple runs may be an issue, computationally costly.

Name: https://bmcbioinformatics.biomedcentral.com/articles/10.1186/s12859-019-2957-4
Title: Visualizing complex feature interactions and feature sharing in genomic deep neural networks
Research question: Visualize how input features interact and contribute in genomic deep learning
Advantage: allows for negative values for relus where deeplift does not. Finds candidatates for ‘addative’ and non-addative interactions
Disadvantage: The method seems to only use gradient ascent, thus less informative for the input space than methods such as DeepLift
Notes: propose Deepresolve to interpret neural networks using gradient ascent. They improve interpertation by allowing negative values (in case of relus) where deeplift does not

Name: https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/34296082/
Title: DeepCOMBI: explainable artificial intelligence for the analysis and discovery in genome-wide association studies
Research question: GWAS with DL
Advantage: Applies statistical test (for multiplicity) after selecting important input features with LRP. Finds new signification associations for T1D and hypertension
Disadvantage: selects input SNPs with p-values, 2 layer deep neural network with ReLu. Chromosome-wise. Model did not finish learning (validation loss was still decreasing)

Name: https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/33305308/
Title: ECMarker: interpretable machine learning model identifies gene expression biomarkers predicting clinical outcomes and reveals molecular mechanisms of human disease in early stages
Research question: Biomarker discovery for early stage disease diagnosis
Advantage: allows lateral connections of input and can therefore derive gene-gene interaction networks important for predictions
Disadvantage: scalability and extension of framework unclear?

Name: https://academic.oup.com/bib/article/23/3/bbac117/6563414?login=false
Title: Differentially expressed genes prediction by multiple self-attention on epigenetics data
Research question: Predict differently expressed genes from methylation and HM
Advantage: Good parameter optimization. Can compare the current position with all positions without large input size using attention.
Disadvantage: Really long range interactions are not taken in account, no 3d information.

Name: https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/34890164/
Title: Multi-Omic Graph Transformers for Cancer Classification and Interpretation
Research question: Graph transfromer network for cancer prediction from MiRNA and mRNA
Advantage: Pathway and molecule attention, multi-omic (mRNA, miRNA)
Disadvantage:
Out of 1,256 miRNAs and
20,502 mRNAs only 168 miRNA and 379 mRNA inputs are used in the graph.
Notes: weights of the last GTL layer aare used as a measure of importance (normalized by number of edges). Implemented on Google Colab but not shared?

Name: https://www.nature.com/articles/s42256-021-00325-y
Title: Integration of multiomics data with graph convolutional networks to identify new cancer genes and their associated molecular mechanisms
Research question: GCN for cancer prediction from multi-omics data
Advantage: Used LRP and subnetworks to identify important genes
Disadvantage: Only looks at gene level and higher

Name: https://www.biorxiv.org/content/10.1101/2021.12.27.474240v1.full.pdf
Title: Network-guided supervised learning on gene expression using a graph convolutional neural network
Research question: Propose GrandLine, a GCN that uses spectral convolutions to predict phenotypes for gene expression data
Advantage: Can identify subnetworks with GradCam. Uses STRING database, uses less trainable parameters than a standard DNN
Disadvantage: arbitrary cut-off for visualization, effectiveness of GradCam hard to judge but works in the simple example.
Notes: adapted GradCam to the spectral domain.

Name: https://academic.oup.com/bioinformatics/article-abstract/38/8/2178/6528315?redirectedFrom=fulltext
Title: Multi-level attention graph neural network based on co-expression gene modules for disease diagnosis and prognosis
Research question: multi-level attention graph neural network for disease prediction
Advantage: Developed a full-gradient graph saliency (FGS) mechanism to highlight disease-relevant genes and pathways.
Disadvantage: Co-expression (edges) are defined by a simple threshold that is optimized for all genes at the same time. Only a small number (~200) of the total features is used (~20 000). They did not test interpretation with simulations.
Notes: Proposes Full-gradient graph saliency (FGS) for interpretation
